subject: Re: [junit] the jvm does NOT shutdown
msgSnippet: why don t you check what thread it is that stays alive? most IDE s display threads in the debugger. that may shed some light. ~mats
messageBody:
why don't you check what thread it is that stays alive?
most IDE's display threads in the debugger.
that may shed some light.

~mats

Sylvain Fraisse wrote:
I am running from an IDE integration. That's true.
But I made a test using a command line and the trouble was exactly the same:
need ^C to stop the TestCase.
It seems then not a problem due to IDE integration.

A comment I can add is that this trouble has been appeared with the Junit
3.7 version.
We used the 3.2 version before and we didn't have this problem.
I had a look in the code and the only reference with Thread I found in the
3.7 version (which was not in the 3.2) is the TestResult.runProtected method
which catch a ThreadDeath exception.

 	catch (ThreadDeath e) { // don't catch ThreadDeath by accident
		throw e;
	}

But I am not sure to understand what this catch is stand for?
So I can not know if it is directly bounded to my problem.

Any feedback?

-sylv1

-----Original Message-----


Are you running from an IDE integration?  If so, it is more likely an
integration probl
em.  Check with the IDE folks (Instantiations?).

-jason

Hi everybody,

I have troubles with TestCases run.
My configuration: junit 3.7, junit.textui.TestRunner
                  jdk 1.3.1 Windows NT version (nobody's perfect ;-),
                  codeguide IDE.

When some TestCases are executed:
- if everything is OK (no error neither failure), no problem.
- if an error appear, no problem
- if a failure is detected, THE JVM DOES NOT SHUTDOWN

But this pattern depends on TestCases. For e.g., at the end of other
TestCases' run, the jvm does not shutdown even every tests are OK.

Is this problem a known problem links to junit or a java runtime problem?
Is anybody have a solution, an idea?

Thanks in advance.

sylv1
